title: Overwolf project idea, any coder interested?

comments.body: Thanks for the cheerups! I still have some hope

comments.author: HawkWasAngel.2571
comments.body:
Hi,

Well, actually i’m on an other OW application for the contest, and I don’t play enough WvW. But I like your idea!

You can post it on the OW idea forum too.

Hope for you someone will do it

comments.author: jenzie.4083
comments.body:
Actually I just want this function in-game. Here’s the idea if anyone likes it, please make it, if you need an UI artist I’m available.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/h3p8k0xy8hzbf7z/Duellist%20UI%201.0.pdf?dl=0

comments.author: jenzie.4083
comments.body:
Hi!

This is a bit late, the OW competition is half way through but I’ve got this idea that could be quite cool. I myself am a UI and industrial designer by day and a tiny mesmer by night.
I know html and some javascript, I’ve made some projects in PHP and I could probably pull this off with some ugly hacks that make programmers cringe but I’d prefer if a REAL programmer could help me.

Any coders out there who still are looking for a project? I dont wanna exaplain the whole idea here but if you are interested I can send over a PDF with my idea. I can say it involves the mumble protocol and wvw.
